entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued July 06 at 1:14PM AKDT until July 08 at 12:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...RED FLAG WARNINGS REMAIN IN EFFECT FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 220, 221, 222, 223, AND 224... Potential for abundant lightning continues in the forecast area with the thermal trough lying from the AlCan Border Crossing to just east of Arctic Village, then west across the Arctic Plain. The thermal trough will rotate to the west and northwest Thursday.

At 517 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Cedar Grove, or 10 miles southeast of Charleston, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph.

entry.title: Flood Watch issued July 06 at 2:42PM MDT until July 06 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: .Large amounts of water in the atmosphere will be present through tonight. Slow moving thunderstorms will continue to develop and expand over the area into tonight. The expected slow movement of the storms combined with the high moisture content air may result in localized flash flooding through tonight. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT...
